text: Zhou Ming (born 7 January 1970) is a retired Chinese athlete who specialised in the long jump. He represented his country at the 1993 World Indoor Championships in Toronto finishing seventh. His personal bests in the event are 8.12 metres outdoors (Changsha 1992) and 7.88 metres indoors (Toronto 1993).All-Athletics profile ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1988 |Asian Junior Championships |Singapore |bgcolor=silver|2nd |7.68 m |- |1991 |Universiade |Sheffield, United Kingdom |4th |7.91 m |- |rowspan=2|1993 |World Indoor Championships |Toronto, Canada |7th |7.84 m |- |East Asian Games |Shanghai, China |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |7.84 m |} ==References== Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Chinese male long jumpers
title: Zhou Ming
